data.title: Who is Martina Navratilova?
data.meta_description: STAR athlete Martina Navratilova garnered a following for her career in professional tennis.Besides her pro-tennis fame, the public is curious to know
data.text:
STAR athlete Martina Navratilova garnered a following for her career in professional tennis.

Besides her pro-tennis fame, the public is curious to know about Martina's personal life.

Who is Martina Navratilova?

Born on October 18, 1956, Martina Navratilova is a Czechoslovakian-American former tennis player.

Martina rose to fame in the 1970s after winning a number of professional titles in the world of tennis.

She won her first Grand Slam at the Wimbledon Arena in 1978 by defeating her opponent Chris Evert.

She took home her ninth Grand Slam victory from the US Open Tennis championship at Wimbledon in 1990.

Martina is also a novelist who published three mystery books with Liz Nickles.

Is Martina married?

Along with her tennis reputation, Martina's personal romances are the center of conversation for sports fans.

From 1979 to 1980, the Grand Slam winner dated novelist Rita Mae Brown.

Following their split, Martina moved on to another published author, Judy Nelson - they dated from 1984 to 1991.

On September 6, 2014, the athlete and Real Housewives of Miami star, Julia Lemigova, announced their engagement.

Martina proposed to the reality TV personality at Arthur Ashe stadium in New York, the location of that year's tennis championships.

The pro-athlete told People: "What’s been amazing is the outpouring of support from everywhere, including when I was walking through the stadium afterwards with people saying, ‘Congratulations,’ people on the street saying, ‘Congratulations.'"

"The changes in people’s attitudes [on gay marriage] is amazing. You put it out to the world and it already feels like we’re married because the whole world knows."

The couple married two months later on December 15.

What is Martina's net worth?

On July 4, 2006, the tennis star announced her retirement at Wimbledon.

According to CNN, she commented: "I just, you know, want to move on to my next life. Most of all, it's to spend more time at home."

"It wasn't an easy decision because tennis has been my life."

Martina added: "I feel proud of everything I have achieved in a sport that has given me so much."

"There have been many years of sacrifice and there have been some hard times, but that will all be forgotten and in the end, I will remember the successes and the good times."

"It's difficult to find the motivation after so many years at the top."

According to Celebrity Net Worth, she amassed a fortune of an estimated $25million.

Martina is the holder of 18 Grand Slam titles and 31 major women's doubles titles.
